intro: Carex multimoda, commonly known as the broad-leaved sedge, is a perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Carex multimoda thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
